Description: Two fragments of an ostracon from a pottery vessel, joined and originally glued. Three lines in hieratic are visible, written in black ink, quite faded. The second line has a large gap in the middle. The sherd belongs to a closed vessel, Nile clay, wheel made, red slip on the outside.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 72)
